newsitem.title: USA: Convest Energy reserves delined in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Convest Energy reserves delined in 1996.

text.p: Convest Energy Corp said Tuesday it had proved reserves at the end of 1996 of 6.3 million barrels of crude oil and 37.58 billion cubic feet of natural gas.
This represents a decline from the company's reserves at December 31, 1995, of 6.5 million barrels of crude oil and 40.55 billion cubic Mmcf of natural gas, it said.
Production during 1996 was 960,000 barrels of crude oil and 13.16 billion cubic feet of natural gas.
The company said its capital expenditure budget for 1997 will be about $16 million, up from 1996's total spending of $10.9 million that included a "very active" drilling program.

Eleven of the fifteen wells drilled in 1996 were successful, it said, noting only one of the 11 successful wells was quantified in the year-end 1995 reserve report as proved reserves. Therefore, ten of these wells represent new additions to the Company's reserves in 1996.
Convest said its drilling success in late 1995 and 1996 has mitigated the steep production decline from the company's offshore gas properties.

As previously announced, the company and its majority shareholder, Edisto Resources Corp, have jointly engaged the investment banking firm of Petrie Parkman & Co Inc to make recommendations for strategic alternatives to enhance shareholder value for both Edisto and Convest.
Petrie Parkman's engagement will include identifying and evaluating potential strategic partners in the oil and natural gas industry for a sale or merger of Edisto and Convest.
